intro: Randia guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan randia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Randia guianensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and wetlands.
